answers.answer: Hello,Uncontrolled blood sugars in both males and females is detrimental to both getting and staying pregnant.Men with high blood sugars may have low and abnormal sperm count.  Women with high blood sugars may have difficulty conceiving, and foetus may have birth defects if sugars are high in early pregnancy and too large and underdeveloped baby if sugars are high in third trimester.However, if blood sugars are well controlled, ideally in range of 80-120, fertility should be equivalent to persons without diabetes.

question: Does diabetis have bad effect on sperm?
title: Getting pregnant & Diabetis
